# Introduction to `ggplot2`

## Here is an example on how to import data

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| eval: true
library(readr)

# Load data
data <- readr::read_delim("/home/onyxia/work/data/DECES_COM_1019.csv", delim = ";")

# Aggregate data
data2 <- data |>
  summarise(nb_deaths2019 = sum(DECESD19, na.rm = TRUE))

```


## Let's produce a plot

Here is a code snippet to produce a beautiful plot done with `ggplot2`.

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| eval: true
library(dplyr)
library(readr)
library(ggplot2)

iris <- iris

ggplot(iris) +
  geom_point(aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Petal.Length, color = Species))
```

And here is the amazing result.

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| echo: false
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

iris <- iris

ggplot(iris) +
  geom_point(aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Petal.Length, color = Species))

```
